pkgmetadata.longdescription: Adaptable Regularized Hotelling's T^2 Test for High-Dimensional Data // Perform the Adaptable Regularized Hotelling's T^2 test (ARHT) proposed by Li et al., (2016) arXiv:1609.08725. Both one-sample and two-sample mean test are available with various probabilistic alternative prior models. It contains a function to consistently estimate higher order moments of the population covariance spectral distribution using the spectral of the sample covariance matrix (Bai et al. (2010) doi:10.1111/j.1467-842X.2010.00590.x). In addition, it contains a function to sample from 3-variate chi-squared random vectors approximately with a given correlation matrix when the degrees of freedom are large.
